conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D render: extruded walls with thickness, visible wall top faces and side faces, elevated angled view, and ceiling/roof removed to show interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with consistent wall thickness and readable interior volumes; clean cutaway. Minor simplifications/softening of some wall junction geometry and openings reduce precision slightly.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and core organization (living left, dining central, kitchen/entry lower-left, bedroom wing right/top) match well. Some discrepancies: balcony/terrace areas from plan are not clearly represented as open balcony spaces in the 3D; bathroom cluster near the master/central core appears simplified and may not exactly match the plan’s two-toilet layout and proportions.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present and placed logically (sofas in living, dining set in dining, beds in bedrooms, wardrobes). Kitchen cabinetry/counters are present. Bathroom fixtures appear present but simplified and not fully verifiable for all toilets from the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear separation of floors/walls/openings with good lighting and minimal artifacts. Presentation is clean with neutral background; windows/doors are readable though not perfectly faithful to plan.

detected_errors.description: Balcony/terrace geometry from the 2D plan is not clearly carried through as distinct open balcony spaces in the 3D render, indicating partial layout feature loss/simplification.
Several door/window placements and opening proportions appear approximated rather than matching exact walls and sizes from the 2D plan.
Bathroom and some built-ins are simplified, limiting verification of exact fixture-to-room correspondence for all toilets shown in the plan.

summary: This is a genuine and clear 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout correspondence, but with noticeable simplification/mismatch of balcony areas and some opening/bathroom details versus the 2D plan.
